intro: Strobilanthes multidens, commonly known as the "Milkweed of the Himalayas," is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with two lips that are often brightly colored. Strobilanthes multidens is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies for various ailments.
